gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਅਨੇਕ ਰੋਗੀ ਅਾਵਤ ਹੈਂ ਬੈਦ ਗਿ੍ਹਿ ਜੈਸੋ ਜੈਸੋ ਰੋਗ ਤੈਸੋ ਅੳੁਖਧੁ ਖੁਵਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Anayk Rogee Aavat Hain Baid Grihi , Jaiso Jaiso Rog Taiso Aoukhadhu Khuvaavaee ?
translation: Just as several patients come to the house of a medical practitioner, and he administers medicine to each one of them according to their ailment.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਾਜ ਦ੍ਵਾਰ ਲੋਗ ਅਾਵਤ ਸੇਵਾ ਨਮਿਤ ਜੋੲੀ ਜਾਹੀਂ ਜੋਗ ਤੈਸੀ ਟਹਿਲ ਬਤਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Raaj Dvaar Log Aavat Sayvaa Namita , Joee Jaaheen Jog Taisee Tahil Bataavaee ?
translation: Just as myriad people come to the door of the king to serve him, and each one is told to prefer service that he is capable and fit to do;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਾਤਾ ਪਾਸ ਜਨ ਅਰਥੀ ਅਨੇਕ ਅਾਵੈਂ ਜੋੲੀ ਜੋੲੀ ਜਾਚੈ ਦੇ ਦੇ ਦੁਖਨ ਮਿਟਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Daataa Paas Jan Aradee Anayk Aavain , Joee Joee Jaachai Day Day Doukhan Mitaavaee ?
translation: Just as many needy persons come to a kind-hearted donor and he gives them whatever each one asks, thus allaying distress of each one of them.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਰਨ ਅਾਵਤ ਹੈਂ ਅਨੇਕ ਸਿਖ ਜੈਸੋ ਜੈਸੋ ਭਾੳੁ ਤੈਸੀ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਪੁਜਾਵੲੀ ॥੬੭੪॥
transliteration: Taisay Gur Saran Aavat Hain Anayk Sikha , Jaiso Jaiso Bhaau Taisee Kaamanaa Pujaavaee ?674?
translation: Similarly many Sikhs come into the refuge of the True Guru, and whatever devotion and love one has in the mind the , True Guru fulfils it accordingly.  (674)
